alert.note: Alert for Monroe (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 16 at 2:41AM EDT until August 16 at 6:45AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Buffalo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Monroe County in western New York... * Until 645 AM EDT. * At 241 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing are producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain has fallen since Tuesday evening. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area as more thunderstorms have developed. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rochester, Greece, Irondequoit, Hilton, Brighton, Gates-North Gates, Charlotte, Braddock Bay and Rochester General Hospital. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
